topic.title: sitePublish is not working
topic.body:
### Step 1: Please describe your environment

  * ZeroNet version: 3417
  * Operating system: Ubuntu 16.04
  * Web browser: -
  * Tor status: always
  * Opened port: yes
  * Special configuration: -

sitePublish is not working after changing zite

bitcoren@nCoin:~$ ~/ZeroNet-0.6.2/zeronet.py sitePublish 1FbmSKV653gt8Q7Cf6ozAf2CUCTmwmtSkE
- Starting ZeroNet...
- OpenSSL loaded, version: 01000207F
- Version: 0.6.2 r3417, Python 2.7.12 (default, Dec  4 2017, 14:50:18) 
[GCC 5.4.0 20160609], Gevent: 1.2.2
- Loading site...
- Unhandled exception: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'settings'
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/bitcoren/ZeroNet-0.6.2/zeronet.py", line 19, in main
    main.start()
  File "/home/bitcoren/ZeroNet-0.6.2/src/main.py", line 537, in start
    actions.call(config.action, action_kwargs)
  File "/home/bitcoren/ZeroNet-0.6.2/src/main.py", line 157, in call
    back = func(**kwargs)
  File "/home/bitcoren/ZeroNet-0.6.2/src/main.py", line 395, in sitePublish
    site.settings["serving"] = True  # Serving the site even if its disabled
AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'settings'
- Unhandled exception
None
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/bitcoren/ZeroNet-0.6.2/zeronet.py", line 91, in <module>
    main()
  File "/home/bitcoren/ZeroNet-0.6.2/zeronet.py", line 64, in main
    traceback.print_exc(file=open(config.log_dir + "/error.log", "a"))
AttributeError: 'Config' object has no attribute 'log_dir'

topic.title: Some optional files can not be downloaded
topic.body:
### Step 1: Please describe your environment

  * ZeroNet version: 3565
  * Operating system: windows 10 / Linux
  * Web browser: Firefox / IE
  * Tor status: enabled/disabled
  * Opened port: yes

Some optional files can not be downloaded
For example:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1uPLoaDwKzP6MCGoVzw48r4pxawRBdmQc/data/users/1NVmmyd8EodLq35QeTbrCm5yAzrtukxRdR/1523041289-1509681876-fqrjjh.zip

On 150 peers not downloads

And over random .JSON, .ZIP optional files
http://localhost:43110/18VUW8Q41aexfwgFTFRJrxqtCqjvdLhLxY/storage/name_filter_all.json

After sign and publish from web interface 18VUW8Q41aexfwgFTFRJrxqtCqjvdLhLxY works well.

topic.title: Sing from command line does not work on big opional files
topic.body:
* ZeroNet version: 3571
  * Operating system: windows 10 / Linux
  * Web browser: Firefox / Vivaldi
  * Tor status: enabled/disabled
  * Opened port: yes

I can not download big optional file: http://localhost:43110/18VUW8Q41aexfwgFTFRJrxqtCqjvdLhLxY/storage/name_filter_all.zip
if i sign and publish it from command line.
Then if sign from web interface download is good.

topic.title: siteCmd command did not work
topic.body:
### Step 1: Please describe your environment

  * ZeroNet version: 4053
  * Operating system: Ubuntu 18.04
  * Web browser: Vivaldi
  * Tor status: not available
  * Opened port: yes

### Step 2: Describe the problem:
```
bitcoren@name:~/ZeroNet-py3$ python3 zeronet.py siteCmd 1KoLHoz1nSddbuf6HbfP19F7Ht7xNBSa6m fileGet content.json
- Starting ZeroNet...
- Libsecpk256k1 loaded
- Version: 0.7.0 r4053, Python 3.6.7 (default, Oct 22 2018, 11:32:17) 
[GCC 8.2.0], Gevent: 1.4.0
FileServer IPv6 not supported: [Errno 101] Network is unreachable
- Unhandled exception: Expecting value: line 1 column 1 (char 0)
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "zeronet.py", line 23, in main
    main.start()
  File "/home/bitcoren/ZeroNet-py3/src/main.py", line 515, in start
    actions.call(config.action, action_kwargs)
  File "/home/bitcoren/ZeroNet-py3/src/main.py", line 111, in call
    back = func(**kwargs)
  File "/home/bitcoren/ZeroNet-py3/src/main.py", line 333, in siteCmd
    res = json.loads(ws.recv())
  File "/usr/lib/python3.6/json/__init__.py", line 354, in loads
    return _default_decoder.decode(s)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.6/json/decoder.py", line 339, in decode
    obj, end = self.raw_decode(s, idx=_w(s, 0).end())
  File "/usr/lib/python3.6/json/decoder.py", line 357, in raw_decode
    raise JSONDecodeError("Expecting value", s, err.value) from None
json.decoder.JSONDecodeError: Expecting value: line 1 column 1 (char 0)
```

  * Web browser: Vivaldi
  * Tor status: available
  * Opened port: yes

#### Expected Results:

 updated zeronet

1604066504_mirrored_bitcoren_github.body: Thanks, i open 43110 port on VPS NAT and all is working.

1604067166_mirrored_yurivict_github.body:
You need to install docker-compose and run with the docker-compose.yml.  
Sample file:
```
version: '3'
services:

  proxy:
    container_name: proxy.zites.cf
    image: nofish/zeronet
    restart: always
    environment:
      ENABLE_TOR: "true"
    volumes:
      - ./data:/root/data
      - ./log:/root/log
      - ./zeronet.conf:/root/zeronet.conf
    ports:
      - "26552:26552"
      - "127.0.0.1:43110:43110"
    command: "sh -c ' ( [ -e /root/plugins/disabled-Multiuser ] && rm -rf /root/plugins/Multiuser && mv /root/plugins/disabled-Multiuser /root/plugins/Multiuser ) && (/usr/bin/tor &) && python zeronet.py --ui_host proxy.zites.cf 127.0.0.1:43110 --ui_ip 0.0.0.0 --fileserver_port 26552'"
```

1604067230_mirrored_bitcoren_github.body: Yes, at first I downloaded the site in the browser.
